    • getInvocationCommandDescription

      public abstract String getInvocationCommandDescription()
      Returns the templated format of the macro command's invocation, such that invocation according to this format will be recognized by isCommandMatch.
      Returns:
      String containing desired information

      public abstract String getBehaviorDescription()
      Returns a brief human readable description of what the macro function does.
      Returns:
      String containing desired information

    • isCommandMatch

      public abstract boolean isCommandMatch(String cmd)
      This method allows the AbstractCommandMacro instance to test if the specified command applies to it. The entire command is passed to the class, allowing for arbitrary filtering, based on the root command and any potential arguments that might be included in the command.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The command to be tested
      Returns:
      true/false if the command applies

    • initialize

      public final void initialize(IOManager io, HarvestProcessor harvestProcessor)
      Initializes the AbstractCommandMacro by passing all the general communication classes for TheAllCommander This method may throw an exception if TheAllCommander has not supplied sufficient configuration information.

      Please see the documentation for IOManager, and HarvestProcessor for information on how to use these classes.

      Parameters:
      io - IOManager
      harvestProcessor - HarvestProcessor

    • processCmd

      public abstract MacroOutcome processCmd(String cmd, int sessionId, String sessionStr)
      TheAllCommander will call processCmd if the instance has responded in the affirmative to "isCommandMatch". At this point, the AbstractCommandMacro will translate the command into any discrete commands which are to be sent to the client.

      For example, if the macro is responsible for reading a series of files, the macro would generate a series of "cat" commands for each desired file. TheAllCommander would then translate "cat" as necessary to the target OS of the receiving daemon.

      As the command is processed, this method will use the MacroOutcome object to build an ordered set of commands and responses. Error states are logged here. TheAllCommander will use the MacroOutcome object to report status to the user

      Parameters:
      cmd - The command from the end user, to be translated
      sessionId - The ID which can be used to send IO to and from the IOManager
      sessionStr - The fully qualified UID for the session
      Returns:
      returns a MacroOutcome object which contains all the commands and responses, as well as any errors
